result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaitlin E Rohde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  
If probation/extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Expunction upon successful completion of sentence.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall notify all healthcare providers of opiate addiction history.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not associate with known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall not be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.
